Keynote

Language: en Complexity: none

Amit Chopra Developer Relations Program Manager, Google Southeast Asia

Google Southeast Asia

Amit is a globetrotter who started his career working in Dubai in 1991. He specialised in Financial Accounting Software. Moved back to Delhi in 1993 working for Digital Equipment Corporation. Got hired by Microsoft in 1994 to be the pre-sale evangelist for Windows 95! Then by Sun Microsystems in 1997 to evangelise Java in India and Singapore. He decided to pursue higher studies and went to Sydney where he got hired by PricewaterhouseCoopers halfway through his Masters as they really got interested in a technology to exchange documents that he was working on as his masters project. In 2000 Microsoft hired him back in Developer Tools groups. He have worked on 6+ releases of Visual Studio product in the last 13 years on a variety of features and developer facing programs. During 2011-13, he once again travelled the world to complete the Global MBA program from the Anderson Business School and the National University of Singapore. And if for some reason he had not stumbled upon a career in Software development, he would have been a Chef! Apart from cooking, he enjoy watching movies and try to spend at least 2-3 hours a week KickBoxing.

Mobile App Development

Language: en Complexity: Beginner

App Monetization

Language: en Complexity: Beginner

Howard Go Mobile Game Developer, MochiBits

Howard Go is ½ of MochiBits, a game development team born on December 2010. He believes the mobile market allows the casual gamer/user to exist which in turn changes the playing field sufficiently to allow more indie developers to play with the big boys (although in smaller, yet thriving niches). He wants to see more Filipinos populate and succeed in the world of mobile app development (before the big boys make it harder).

Code Labs: HTML5 Game Development

Language: en Complexity: Beginner

Want to create your own HTML5 game? Be sure to attend this Code Lab Session.

Benj Tupas Game and Framework Developer, Blueprint Gaming

Google Developer Group

Benj Tupas graduated from the University of Saint La Salle-Bacolod just this year. Now, he is a Game and Framework Developer at Blueprint Gaming, a company that develops casino games for mobile devices, web platforms, desktops, and arcade machines. He is in-charge in building frameworks that bridge the gap between HTML5 technologies and embedded systems to run HTML5 games on casino slot machines, multiple screens display, and mobile devices.

He is the co-manager of Google Developers Group Bacolod. A young technopreneur who founded Codefaci.com to facilitate people in building their ideas into apps and a part time freelancer who develops web applications. Outside his geeky world, he enjoys going to the gym and playing the guitar.

Startup

Language: en Complexity: Beginner

Pia Bernal Social Enterprise Investments Manager and Communications Head, Kickstart Ventures

Pia joined Kickstart Ventures in September 2012 as its manager for social enterprise investments.

Before Kickstart, Pia was with Globe Telecom for six years managing corporate social responsibility (CSR) programs in education and social protection services that harnessed telco core competencies (mobile and broadband technologies, m-commerce and VAS solutions) to achieve operational efficiencies and scale. Her work on the use of ICT in public schools and working with local and international non-profit organisations and key government agencies for the delivery of social protection services have resulted to user behaviour insights and managing multi-stakeholder expectations in the use of ICT-based solutions.

Pia holds a Bachelor of Arts in Development Studies from the University of the Philippines in Manila. She has received recognitions and awards from Globe Telecom, the International Association of Business Communicators (IABC/Philippines), Public Relations Society of the Philippines, and the American Chamber CSR Excellence Awards.

Community Updates

Language: en Complexity: none

Aside from the Google Communities, we have other tech communities who woud like to give an update on what they are currently brewing. Let's know more about the Map Maker Community (Google Maps), Robogals CDO (Robotics), Py-Tsada (Python), ITG-X Java Dev Knots (Java), and MinRUG (Ruby).

Romar Micabalo DevOps Sysadmin, Innovuze Solutions, Inc.

Information Technology Group - Region X

Google Communities

Wearable Technology

Language: en Complexity: Beginner

Know more about Android Wear, Android Lollipop, Cardboard, Chromecast, and more!

Josan Astrid Dometita Community Manager, UI/UX Designer, GDG Cagayan de Oro, Aestrea Software Development

Google Developer Group Information Technology Group - Region X

Josan Astrid Dometita is an HTML5 enthusiast and the Google Developer Group Community Manager for Cagayan de Oro City. Having the interest in the complex ins and outs of computer technology made her earn her Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, with a major in Software Engineering. While still in school, she started freelancing online as a web developer, and expanded her portfolio of skills to become a vector artist and motion graphics animator. She started working as a Multimedia Developer in Manila and together with her friends, then built their own consulting and startup company, Aestrea Software Development, where she is the Creative Director. She calls herself codesigner (coder/designer), a hybrid name that could best describe her skill set, bridging the gap between both the design and development worlds.

Google Developer Group

Product Design Sprint

Language: en Complexity: Beginner

Carlo Borja Co-Community Manager, Google Business Group

Google Business Group

Carlo Borja is an Online Marketing Specialist specializing in digital marketing, social media, search engine optimization and general inbound marketing.

He is currently the head of online marketing for Staff.com, a global recruitment platform and Time Doctor, a time management software.

Apart from his online career, he is also the community co-manager for social media of GBG Cagayan de Oro handling all web related concerns and organizing events for the growing business community in the city.

In addition to that, he is also a youth pastor at a local church while at the same time a musical director of a worship team.
